similaranime.anime: Ano Hi Mita Hana no Namae o Bokutachi wa Mada Shiranai.

recommendations.recommendation: Baseball is not my thing but i got hooked to this show somehow....
Don`t pass it off just because it has sport in it, that`s missing the point.
i hate baseball, but this seems interesting

This show hit my weak spot... numerous times. I cried, I tensed up in suspense, I grinned, I laughed... it brought out a lot of emotion and kept me wanting more for the entire series. The simple soundtrack did surprisingly well at setting the mood and the characters were all very likable. I watched Touch after this, but this is tons more enjoyable IMO.
RECOMMENDED
The characters in this show are very very lovable, especially the main characters. I especially love how Kou reacts to the situations he is in.
this is a really great series, even if youre not a fan of base ball, the histori is catching and fun, the characters are great too, it was a really nice surprice to find this anime for me
Can be a bit of a hit and miss with people. It was a hit for me.
I think it is romance anime with baseball background, but it is really a great story.

The first time I watch one of Adachi-sensei`s works being animated. But to be honest, I think these one is not meant for anime. The manga is way way much better. But regardless, if u dont want to read, this is still a good show.

I liked the ending, but it seemed like almost 3/4 of the episodes were unnecessary filler episodes. Plus i think there was too much emphasis on baseball. I wished it was more focused on the storyline, because it had a great one. The ending was great even though i predicted it from the beginning.
Truly a series that bridges the sports and drama genres. A real gem!
Great!!! Definity Recommend
One of the best slice of life shows out there. A must watch.
had this one for a long time, not an sport fan. Now i have to reduce all my 10 rated anime´s because this is the best i have ever seen, truly an masterpiece in a league of its own..

Watched the entire season 3 times and I still think it is one of the best animes I have ever watched. You don`t have to like baseball to enjoy it, but if you do it makes it that much cooler. Besides the baseball the story is actually quite deep and the relationships and characters are amazing and very touching. Probably one of the first animes to bring out a large emotional response from me. Great anime.....if you read this far you should just watch it already.

This anime is simply awesome. The baseball setting is just an overlay of what this anime is actually about: Adolosence, Love, Tears, Dreams... everything that defines growing up. The artwork is mediocre, the pace is continious but slowly progressing, the love aspect is subtle - yet I didn`t feel bored any second, it just grabs you until you finished the series. This anime has this special something, the character development is outstandingly well done, the whole series is overlayed by a good nature feeling. This is an anime I`d even put on my recommendations list for non-anime watchers. A masterpiece that comes along only once in a while.

One of the Best series of all time......Just watch the first episode....u will cry!!.....I loved it very much!!.....the setting is baseball but its not just that......romance, comedy are also the best!! a definately 10/10.

This one took me by a surprise a bit. I didn`t have any expectations going other than it was another sports/baseball anime but the characters, story, and relationships were really what made this one great.
It`s closer to a slice of life with baseball as the backdrop. (although baseball does play an important part).
Watch it.

Cross game is definitely one of the best series I`ve seen in quite a while, though the hardest thing for me is explaining just why I liked it so much. It`s undoubtedly very well-made, but Cross game has something more than that. Because of the dynamic scene transitions, a good usage of flashbacks and perfect music timing I simply couldn`t help feeling emotionally invested in each episode. It`s the kind of series where I`ll go from laughing to crying within just a few seconds, and at the next scene I`m at the edge of my seat in anticipation—a lot of this can be attributed to Sekita Osamu`s excellent directing.
If you haven`t watched it already I`d highly recommend doing so, at the very least you`ll find it worth seeing.
Baseball, dreams and coping with grief. The show develops almost all of its characters extremely well and isn`t afraid to not strictly state how any one character is feeling. A rare gem.
Storytelling done right. Alive characters and a compelling setting, with a great storyline. Audiovisually entrancing.
Depictions of baseball are accurate, exciting, and often stunningly majestic. Character development is masterful. Story is never boring or predictable. From beginning to end, a fantastic series.
I barely knew anything about baseball before I watched this! A must watch, whether you like baseball or not!
unbelievable... this is... 最高...
Awesome! Best anime i`ve ever watched.
This is a MUST SEE. Even if you don`t like baseball, you must see this; the character development is superb, and no anime I have seen so far has come close to this. SEE IT NAOWS!!

definitely my second favorite baseball anime. not as great as Major, but outpaces one outs by a long shot. one of the few shows that i`ve seen in a while that combines a great story with amazing character development. 50 eps, and i`m still wanting more. highly recommended.
First episode hooked me in. Awesome show, even for people who hate sports. The anime focuses more on the drama/slice of life with the baseball merely supporting the story.
Just what anime is about! Give it a try, sure you`ll love the characters and the story.
Simply put... spectacular. Don`t be fooled by the gentle story, it`s really awesome.

A masterpiece in every single aspect. If you can watch just one more anime in your life, look no further.
Just take *everyone`s* advice and watch the show - and don`t look for more info - you really need to stay clear of spoilers on this one...

I usually avoid sports anime like the plague, but this series is so much more than that. The character development is amazing and the pacing is great over so many episodes. The baseball games are intense and yet there is also great romance and masterfully done sadness.
Not many Anime deserve a must see recommendation in the past years. Cross game definitely is one one of them though. Brilliant character development combined with a storyline that is second to none.
Unbelievable... I couldn`t stop watching it until it finished. It has everything: romance, drama, action, sports...One of my all-time favs!!
couldn`t stop watching
This is an amazing anime. Must see even if not a sports anime fan... You won`t regret it!
great!!!!
Even if you`re not a fan of baseball, there`s much more to this series. It really does make you laugh and cry. I think it`s one of the best anime I`ve seen so far.
Stop reading the recommendations and for god`s sake go watch this if you still haven`t! You`ll thank me later - I guarantee!

anime.description: * Based on a shounen manga by http://anidb.net/cr859 [Adachi Mitsuru], serialised in http://anidb.net/cr23232 [Weekly Shounen Sunday]. Cross Game is the story of http://anidb.net/ch5809 [Kitamura Kou] and the four Tsukishima sisters, http://anidb.net/ch5812 [Ichiyou], http://anidb.net/ch5811 [Wakaba], http://anidb.net/ch5810 [Aoba], and http://anidb.net/ch5813 [Momiji]. The Tsukushima family runs a batting center with an attached coffee shop, and Kou`s father runs a neighbouring sporting goods store. Wakaba and Kou were born on the same day in the same hospital, and have been close friends since childhood — close enough that Wakaba treats Kou as her boyfriend, even though nothing is officially declared. Aoba, who is one year younger than Wakaba and Kou, doesn`t like how Kou is taking her sister away from her and claims she hates him.

tag.name: baseball
tag.description: Baseball is like a complicated version of Rounders. It involves hitting a ball with a stick, then running around several bases placed in the form of a diamond on a field. Big in the US, and also in Japan.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: animal sidekick
tag.description: Every mahou shoujo anime needs them, the cute little critters that are supposed to help the protagonists but in reality are nothing but useless bystanders most often abused for gags. Kids love them but they can also often turn into an annoyance.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: tsundere
tag.description: Tsundere (ツンデレ) (pronounced /(t)sʌnˈdɪə(r)/ in English or /t͡sun.de.ɽe/ in Japanese) is a Japanese concept of a character archetype which describes a person with a conceited, irritable, and/or violent personality that suddenly becomes modest and loving when triggered by some sort of cause (such as being alone with someone). The inverse scenario, where a modest and loving person becomes conceited/irritable/violent, is also a tsundere. The default state does not matter. The character can default to "tsuntsun" or "deredere"; the key concept is the fact that there`s a (generally very quick) flip from one mode to the other. It can also describe a contradictory personality which is good-willed on the inside, but with a harsh attitude on the outside. Originally found in Japanese bishoujo games, the word is now part of the otaku moe phenomenon, reaching into other media such as anime, manga, novels, and even mass media. Tsundere is a portmanteau of the two words tsuntsun (ツンツン), and deredere (デレデレ). Tsuntsun is defined as "aloof, morose, pointed", and deredere is defined as "exhausted, lovestruck". Tsunderekko (ツンデレっ娘) is a related noun, referring to a girl with a tsundere personality. Like nekomimi, tsundere is considered a moe-inspiring character trait. The concept has received increasing attention in Japan, with a tsundere cafe opened in Akihabara and tsundere-themed products released (like Tomy Co.`s portable television set), and the concept increasingly reflected in recent anime, from an extended discussion of the meaning of the concept and its origin on the internet in http://anidb.net/a4777 [Lucky Star]`s Lucky Channel segment to merchandise for http://anidb.net/a3651 [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya] classifying the characters according to tsundere-ness. Another accepted definition of tsundere is a girl who has a combative attitude toward others but is also kind on the inside. She usually plays out as having an attitude toward the main character, usually a male, and often criticizing him in one way or another, but as the series progresses she eventually warms up to him and sometimes even falls in love with him.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: love polygon
tag.description: A love polygon refers to a romantic relationship involving n people. Although a love triangle is not limited to just heterosexual relationships, in anime, it usually deals with two females liking one male and vice versa.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: training
tag.description: Training is extensive, serious practising a person undergoes in order to develop skills and abilities, such as handling weapons, playing instruments, playing sports, and so on.

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: family without mother
tag.description: For some reason, the protagonist`s mother is no longer among the living. The much-too-early death was due to sickness or accident. This plot device adds a certain degree of tragedy to the anime, and usually has repercussions on the rest of the family. For example: the grief-stricken father and children barely function as humans; the oldest daughter has an extra burden of raising the other children, additional emphasis is given to the only female child in the family, i.e. with bishounen brother and dad in a shoujo setting. In rare cases the mother may still be alive, just not living with the rest of the family presently, i.e. on some quest or job and gone for a long time.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

character.name: Kitamura Kou
character.description: In 5th grade in Part One, enters Seishuu High School at the start of Part Two. Kou lives down the street from the Tsukishima family and is treated like one of the family when he visits their house, batting cage, or coffee shop. He has been practically inseparable from Wakaba since their birth on the same day in the same hospital. While he shows little interest in baseball to outsiders, he has practiced daily at the Tsukishima Batting Center since he was old enough to swing a bat, enough so he is an excellent batter, especially against fastballs. Kou is inspired by Aoba`s excellent pitching form to become a great pitcher himself, and secretly adopts Aoba`s daily training regimen. Although he doesn`t play baseball in junior high, his friends convince him to join the high school baseball club. Because Kou and his friends don`t take the placement test, they are put on the second string team (called the "prefab" team). With his changeup fastball, he becomes a well-known ace pitcher in the eastern conference.

character.name: Tsukishima Aoba
character.description: Third daughter of the Tsukishima family, one year younger than Kou and Wakaba. Aoba is jealous of how much time Wakaba spends with Kou, and frequently tells Kou how much she hates him. She is an excellent pitcher, having modeled her pitching form after Junpei Azuma. She has a poster of Ryota Igarashi, a famous fastball pitcher, hanging on her bedroom wall, and says she is only interested in a guy who can pitch a fastball at 160 km/h (about 100 mph). She loves to pitch in practice games, even though as a girl she cannot play in official baseball. However, she rarely shows her real speed as most catchers can`t handle it. Her name means "blue leaf".

character.name: Tsukishima Wakaba
character.description: Second daughter of the Tsukishima family, in 5th grade in Part One. Through their childhood, Wakaba is constantly with Kou. She constantly talks about their future together, even giving him a schedule of suggested future birthday gifts that includes an engagement ring for her 20th birthday. She frequently kisses Kou, which annoys their mutual friend Akaishi, who has a secret crush on her. For his eleventh birthday (and the second birthday in a row), Wakaba gives Kou an alarm clock because he has a hard time waking up in the morning. Her name means "young leaf".

character.name: Tsukishima Ichiyou
character.description: First daughter of the Tsukishima family. At the start of Part Two, she is in her third year of college. After her mother`s death, she has run the Tsukishima household, acting as a surrogate mother for her sisters. She treats Kou like a younger brother. Her cooking is generally good, though she sometimes makes something wrong. She likes Junpei Azuma, but has trouble expressing her feelings to him directly. Her name means "first leaf".

character.name: Tsukishima Momiji
character.description: Fourth and youngest daughter of the Tsukishima family. She is in kindergarten during Part One, and in 5th grade at the start of Part Two. Although she lost her mother at a very young age, she has a happy, energetic, and outgoing personality. Despite their difference in ages, Momiji and Kou have a friendly, sibling-like relationship. She catches for him when he practices pitching. Once, while playing catch, Aoba apologizes for throwing the ball so hard and Momiji says she is used to it as Kou`s pitches are harder—to Aoba`s surprise. Momiji grows up to resemble her older sister Wakaba, which surprises Akaishi the first time he meets her. Her name means "maple leaf" or "crimson leaf".

character.name: Azuma Yuuhei
character.description: Younger brother of Junpei Azuma, in the same year as Kou. Yuuhei transferred to Seishuu High School in order play baseball on the first-string team, and remains after the coach is dismissed. He has trouble recalling other people`s names and faces, but he remembers meeting Kou at the Tsukishima Batting Center several months before transferring to Seishuu. He lost some of his self-confidence after his transfer, but seeing Kou`s abilities during the practice game boosted his spirits. Junpei injured his leg, ending his rising baseball career, while saving Yuuhei from falling down a staircase. Since then, Yuuhei has been very careful around all stairs and the guilt gave him a renewed drive to make it to the Koushien. He currently has stated romantic interests in Aoba.

character.name: Akaishi Osamu
character.description: Akaishi is a childhood friend of Kou and Wakaba, the same age as them, whose father owns a liquor/sake store in the neighborhood. In Part One, he has a crush on Wakaba and is jealous of Kou. In elementary school, is able to throw a 100 km/h fastball but is thrown out of Little League for fighting with opposing teams. After Wakaba`s death, Akaishi switches to catcher to fulfill Wakaba`s last dream in which Kou pitches to him at Koushien. At the start of high school, he refuses to take Coach Daimon`s placement test and is placed on the prefab team with Kou, and plans the boys` strategy to get rid of Daimon. Kou describes Akaishi as a brilliant catcher, and according to Aoba, Akaishi is one of the few people able to catch her pitches at full power. Coach Maeno sometimes consults with him over game strategy, and makes Akaishi the team captain during his third year. He is greatly shocked when he meets Akane Takigawa because of her resemblance to Wakaba, and while he has feelings for her, he actively works to bring her and Kou together.

character.name: Senda Keiichirou
character.description: A member of the Seishuu baseball team, in the same year as Kou. Senda claims to be a lady`s man, and constantly pursues Aoba as well as other girls. He is the only non-recruit to pass Coach Daimon`s placement test, and is placed on the first-string team as a pitcher. Because of this, during his first semester he frequently brags about how good he must be. Coach Maeno comments that Senda is too much of a showoff to be a good pitcher but would be a good "flashy shortstop". After making too many errors as pitcher during the first scrimmage between the first-string and prefab teams, he is demoted to the prefab team, where Maeno substitutes him as shortstop. After Coach Daimon is fired, Senda becomes the starting shortstop and leadoff batter. In his third year of high school, he becomes impressed by Aoba`s hard work and begins taking practice more seriously.

character.name: Nomo
character.description: The Tsukishima`s black-and-white cat. He appears in the background throughout the series. He is named after Nomo Hideo (former Japanese baseball player who had success in the MLB).

character.name: Daimon Shuugo
character.description: A nationally renowned high school baseball coach, having taken teams to Koushien several times, winning it twice. He is hired by Interim Principal Shidou, replacing Coach Maeno in the process, to build up Seishuus baseball team. He recruits his own players from around the country, including Azuma and Miki, to create a first-string team, relegating the existing baseball club to a second-string squad called the prefab or farm team—which he calls a "cesspool". He is depicted as proud and rigid: Senda tells the rest of the prefab team there is no chance of being promoted back to first-string, because that would require Daimon to admit he made a mistake, and Miki is demoted to the bench for disobeying a direct order to make a play. Akaishi criticizes Daimon for using up players in order to win, noting that despite his career record, none of his former players have succeeded as pros. During the rematch scrimmage with the prefab team, Daimon refuses to acknowledge that Kou has become a better pitcher, that his team needs Miki, or that he must change his set coaching strategy. After losing the scrimmage, Daimon is forced to resign along with Shidou. He then becomes head coach for Kurokoma Jitsugyou, employing the same talent-buying strategy he used in Seishuu, where he loses in the first round of the regional tournament because he refuses to take Miki`s team seriously.

character.name: Azuma Junpei
character.description: Older brother of Yuuhei Azuma, several years older than him. Junpei was a star pitcher and cleanup batter in high school, who was being scouted by pro teams during his last year of school. His team was on the verge of winning the regional finals when he sustained a career-stopping leg injury while saving Yuuhei from falling down a staircase, and he quit baseball and now runs a small produce distributor. He is depicted as cheerful and feckless, but Yuuhei claims initially his cheerfulness is forced; Kou describes Junpei as unreliable, in part because he never follows through on his promise to find Yuuhei an apartment. Upon meeting Ichiyou, the summer of Kou`s second year of high school, Junpei immediately starts courting her, and they eventually start going out. In Kou`s third year, Ichiyou promises to marry him if Seishuu makes it to Koushien, and Junpei becomes an assistant coach for Seishuu`s baseball team, enthusiastically cheering the team on because his wedding is riding on it.

character.name: Hayashi
character.description: Third strongest fighter at Kou`s grade school and one of Akaishi`s friends.

character.name: Nawata
character.description: Fifth strongest fighter at Kou`s grade school and one of Akaishi`s friends.

character.name: Takigawa Akane
character.description: A girl the same age as Ko with an uncanny resemblance to http://anidb.net/ch5811 [Tsukishima Wakaba] as she would be if she had lived. Her parents open a soba restaurant across the street from Kitamura Sporting Goods the summer of Ko`s second year of high school. She is an excellent artist, and won the grand prize of the Koshien Poster Art Competition using Aoba as the model for a pitcher. She is enrolled in Seisen Private Girl`s Academy. Akane becomes a waitress at Coffee Clover because she does not get paid working at her parents` restaurant, and becomes close to Aoba, telling her she always wanted a younger sister. Akane has suffered from an unknown disease since childhood, and the summer of her third year of high school is admitted into the hospital for tests leading to surgery. She promises Ko she will go out with him after she is discharged. This is later forgotten as she sacrifices her own feelings towards Ko and helps Aoba show her feelings as well. It is shown that she shows kindness towards Akaishi. Source: wiki

character.name: Asami Mizuki
character.description: Asami Mizuki is Aoba`s cousin, the same age as her. Mizuki`s father, Asami Isamu, is a younger brother of the Tsukishima sisters` mother and a world-renowned mountain climber. As a result of his father`s travels, Mizuki has been raised overseas most of his life, and is an excellent climber. He returns to Japan to attend high school, living with the Tsukishimas and enrolling in Seishu at the same time as Aoba. He is popular with girls but he claims to be interested in only Aoba. He initially sees Ko as his rival for Aoba, and frequently mentions that Ko does not yet pitch 100 mph, but he comes to recognize Yuhei Azuma as a rival as well. He is in the mountaineering club at school, which he uses as a cover for his own activities as the club activities are below his skills. He is often depicted free climbing tall structures, such as poles and school buildings, without equipment. Source: wiki

character.name: Koganezawa Midori
character.description: Senda`s cousin. She plays in Satomi women`s team.

character.name: Yashiro
character.description: A member of baseball team, same year as Aoba.

character.name: Mitani
character.description: A member of baseball team, same year as Aoba.

character.name: Ehara
character.description: A member of baseball team, same year as Aoba.

character.name: Onoda
character.description: First-String player: second batter, right fielder.

character.name: Kubo
character.description: First-String player: fifth batter, third baseman.

character.name: Takizawa
character.description: First-String player: sixth batter, catcher.

character.name: Ishiguro
character.description: First-String player: seventh batter, second baseman.

character.name: Ogura
character.description: First-String player: eight batter, left fielder.

character.name: Matsuyama Yuki
character.description: Captain and catcher of Satomi women`s team.

character.name: Kojima Minako
character.description: Pitcher of Satomi women`s team.

character.name: Ozaki
character.description: Right fielder of Ouka women`s team. Clean up hitter.

character.name: Sawaguchi
character.description: Pitcher of Ouka women`s team.

character.name: Sakurakouji
character.description: Pitcher of Kirigaoka West. Also known as "The Smiling Prince". Has his own fanclub within the school.

character.name: Mishima Keitarou
character.description: Third baseman of Ryuou Academy.

character.name: Terada Kantoku
character.description: Baseball coach of Ryuou Academy.

character.name: Nishiguchi Kantoku
character.description: Baseball coach of Sannou High.

character.name: Shimano Tadashi
character.description: First baseman and clean up hitter of Ryuou Academy.

character.name: Oikawa Takurou
character.description: Second pitcher of Ryuou Academy. His fastballs exceeds 140km/h.

character.name: Matsushima
character.description: First pitcher of Ryuou Academy. His fastballs exceeds 140km/h.

character.name: Tsuchida
character.description: Tsuchida is a boy who had a crush on Aoba for a long time and gave her a love-letter in the middle of match with Ryuou Academy. He has a friend named Omura with him who also has a crush on Aoba and also has a love-letter for her.

character.name: Akane Chichi
character.description: Father of Takigawa Akane.

character.name: Akane Haha
character.description: Mother of Takigawa Akane.

character.name: Keikan
character.description: A detective who is catching the suspicious guy at school which Akane attends.

character.name: Fushinsha
character.description: A man who was hiding in the girl`s dressing room.

character.name: Take Gen
character.description: A man who tried to look good to Akane by making some guys scare her.

character.name: Imai
character.description: Momiji`s friend. He trains aikido.

character.name: Shimano Megumi
character.description: Cousin of Shimano Tadashi and clean-up hitter from Ryuou girls Academy. Known as "Shimakei".

character.name: Takei
character.description: Women national team coach.

character.name: Fukuda
character.description: Fukuda Hiromi is the ace of Sapporo Ladybirds, who won last year`s Summer Championship.

character.name: Kangoshi
character.description: A nurse from hospital where Aoba stayed with broken leg.

character.name: Kojima
character.description: Coach of Kinjo High school baseball team.

character.name: Stalker Otoko
character.description: A man who stalked Aoba and then Akane.

character.name: Hama
character.description: A member of baseball team, same year as Aoba.

character.name: Sena Koukou Kantoku
character.description: Coach of Sena High School.

character.name: Nisikura Kantoku
character.description: Coach of Nisikura High School baseball team.

episode.title: ニヤニヤするな
Wipe That Smirk Off Your Face
Jangan Cengengesan
Niyaniya Suruna
世界中で一番...

Sekaijuu de Ichiban...
